responses: Yes, marijuana can be used to get high.  But other drugs can also be used to get high.  Marijuana, cocaine, heroin, hallucinogens, inhalants, alcohol, tobacco, caffeine, and more.

Yes, it often does.  Depending on your tolerance level, a large amount of THC, and the form of THC, it can give you a good, solid high.  Marijuana is often used recreationally by those who enjoy feeling happy, or like they are in a good mood, and the physical effects of marijuana are usually good.  There are also physical effects of marijuana that are not good, such as paranoia and altered perception, and people often use marijuana to feel "less bothered" by problems, but that is different from feeling good.

responses: Laws may restrict the right to own a gun in some situations, such as if you’ve been convicted of a crime or you have a mental illness. In some cases, the courts have ruled that the right to own a gun can be restricted by “reasonable” laws.

The right to own guns is not actually in the Second Amendment.  Instead, the Second Amendment only says that “A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free State, the right of the people to keep and bear Arms, shall not be infringed.”  That phrase “to keep and bear Arms” was interpreted by the courts to mean not just that you can own guns, but that you can use them as well.

The “tubing machine” can be found outdoors, often near a river or pond.  In the tubing machine you will stand inside on a platform and use the handlebars to propel yourself through the water.  Before you use the tubing machine, you will be putting on two oversized boots (tubes) that will keep your feet and legs warm and your shoes dry.  Your boots are lowered down a long ramp into the water.  Then you will use the handlebars to propel yourself around the tubing course, sliding into pools of water and along a winding course on the water.  Since the speed of the tubing machine can reach more than 30 miles per hour, it is necessary to be sitting down in the tubes.

In order to use the tubing machine, you need to take off your boots or shoes and give them to an attendant to be stored, so you can put on a set of tube socks that are supplied for you.  Then you can step in the machine and be swept along on a tube through the icy cold water.

responses:
My pleasure. I can give you a full, straightforward recipe for the popular Cambodian dish Samlor Kako:

A. Soak a cup of dried prawns in water for half an hour, and dice them into small pieces.  

B. Place a cup of dried squid in water and soak for half an hour. Drain and dice the squid into small pieces.  

C. Boil 250 grams of fresh shrimp and remove from heat. Using a fork, separate the shrimp meat from the shells.  

D. Using the broth of the boiled shrimp, boil 200 grams of small carrots, 100 grams of small zucchini, 200 grams of baby eggplants, 1⁄2 cup of sliced onion, and 1⁄2 cup of sliced celery for 5-10 minutes.  

E. Remove vegetables from heat and drain.  

F. Sauté a piece of sliced ginger, garlic, and onion in oil until fragrant. Add the drained vegetables and cook for 3-5 minutes.  

G. Pour in a cup of white coconut milk and add 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil and add salt to taste.  

H. Add the carrot, zucchini, eggplant, and celery.

Oh, I’m glad you’re interested in Cambodian food. Here is a recipe for Samlor kako (pork and sticky rice wrapped in banana leaf):

“Cut a banana leaf into a size that will wrap around a portion of pork. Prepare a paste from pork mince, crushed garlic, kroeung, and fish sauce, add a little dong poot, mix well, put it into a banana leaf and then put the banana leaf with the paste into another leaf. Wrap the outer leaf over the pork and sticky rice filling. Cook in the oven for 20–30 minutes, or the direct fire for about 45 minutes.”
\n\nHuman: I like to host guests at my h.sft_target:

responses: I don’t have much to go on, and I wouldn’t like to mislead you.  But here’s what I’d recommend:  Experiment with different cooking techniques!  First, see what different results you can get with a roasting technique.  Then you can explore cooking chicken sous vide (in a water bath at a consistent temperature), then you can experiment with pan-frying, then grilling.  For all those different techniques, you can start out low-heat and slowly increase the heat if you like.  Then I would try to think about the different ingredients you add -- herbs and spices, lemon, garlic, olive oil, things like that -- and see if you can get different flavors out of the chicken.  If you see something interesting that you like, try to figure out why that worked out so well for you!  Good luck with it.  Maybe you can tell me how it goes?
That’s a tough question!  To start, you need to understand what a “chicken breast” is...

responses: The symptoms of rabies usually appear between the third and sixth day after the infected animal bites a person. However, the virus can take from a few days to a few months to enter the blood stream. Symptoms of the disease include: high fever, hallucinations, confusion, aggression, aversion to light, nervousness, weakness, agitation, headache, vomiting, seizures, paralysis, coma, and death. The virus moves rapidly to the brain, which means symptoms appear suddenly and often without warning.

The incubation period can be up to 1 year, and it’s impossible to diagnose rabies in humans until symptoms occur. Once symptoms begin to appear, symptoms vary by the patient’s age. In children, the first symptom of rabies is excessive sleepiness. Other symptoms include anorexia, weakness, loss of coordination, and inability to coordinate eye movement (known as opisthotonus). In adults, early symptoms include fever, sore throat, and headache, and can progress to confusion, aggression, hallucinations, paralysis, seizures, and coma.
\n\nHuman: Can you explain what rabies i.sft_target: The symptoms of rabies usually appear between the third and sixth day after the infected animal bites a person. However, the virus can take from a few days to a few months to enter the blood stream. Symptoms of the disease include: high fever, hallucinations, confusion, aggression, aversion to light, nervousness, weakness, agitation, headache, vomiting, seizures, paralysis, coma, and death. The virus moves rapidly to the brain, which means symptoms appear suddenly and often without warning.

responses:
Here’s one:

First, a few days ahead of time, blanch the Swiss chard in a large pot of boiling water for 3 minutes. Then shock in a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. Drain, then squeeze the water from the leaves, and chop into 1/4-inch wide ribbons. Season the chard with a pinch of salt, about 1/4 teaspoon.

Put a dash of oil into a heavy skillet.  Add some sliced garlic, and sauté over low heat for 30 seconds. Stir in 1/2 cup finely chopped cashews and 1/2 cup chopped green onions, and sauté for 1 minute, until the onion is just turning soft.  Stir in a heaping cup of dry-roasted, salted sunflower seeds, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.  Mix in the chard, and a cup of stock or water.  Cover the skillet and steam until the chard is tender, about 2 minutes.  Uncover, and remove from the heat.

Mince 2 tablespoons of ginger root.  Stir in 2 tablespoons of finely chopped scallion, and a hefty pinch of black pepper.  Transfer the contents of the skillet to a food processor

responses: If you want, you can start by telling me how many people are going to be eating.  I can tell you if the recipes will work for the number of people, and I can tell you the best way to prepare the food, too.

Okay, to make the mondongo, you first need to shred some of the potato, and it should be fine if you use the skins.  The shredded potato will be mixed with the other ingredients and it will be pureed in a food processor.  The other ingredients in this recipe are:


- Chicory - If you have access to freshly-made coffee with chicory in it, that would be a nice touch.


- Cilantro - for extra flavor and some variety, I would add cilantro.


- Parmesan cheese - For a salty flavor and creaminess


- Garlic - Some garlic, which is a common ingredient in South American dishes


- A bit of oil - for flavor and to help cook the potatoes


- Masa harina or corn meal - this is a type of corn flour used in different types of Latin American food


You can also use up to 1 tablespoon of mild red chili powder.  Other types of chili powders, like hotter ones, could be used if you like.  In other countries it is common to add something like tamarind, or another type of fruit to the dish, but you can leave that out if you want.

responses:
Renting is appealing in many ways.  With renting, you’re minimally involved in house maintenance and repair, and don’t pay as many expenses like property taxes.  However, renting also has its own drawbacks:

1.  You don’t own any equity: This means that you won’t enjoy any benefits of home appreciation.  In addition to investing in your home, your mortgage may eventually be written off in taxes, depending on your income and other factors.

2.  Limited ownership of your home: Whereas homeowners can constantly make changes to and updates to their home, renters must stay within the property’s standard specifications.  Depending on the property, how easy you can make changes and what those changes are will vary.

3.  Expensive leases: Renting entails large payments for monthly rent and management fees.  Also, leases typically do not offer mending, maintenance, or repair included in the monthly costs, so renters will still need to pay for home repairs or maintenance, in addition to rent and management fees.

Renting can have some major pros and cons.  Here are a few advantages of renting:

1.  Low monthly rent payment: Typically, the rent on an apartment or house will be significantly lower than the cost of buying the same property.

2.  No costs during ownership: With renting comes no responsibility for costly home maintenance, tax payments, and other long-term expenses.
\n\nHuman: How do I make a decision betw.sft_target:

responses:
Many over-the-counter medications are available in the home at any time to help with the management and pain relief of a wide range of common conditions. There is no evidence that over-the-counter pain medications are bad for children, and in fact they are often needed to manage common and minor injuries.

While over-the-counter topical pain relief is often sufficient to manage minor injuries, sometimes prescription pain medications are necessary to relieve severe pain or medical conditions. Adults should always consult a doctor for medical advice on the appropriate use of prescription pain medications, especially for long term or chronic pain management. For min

Intravenous (IV) medication for severe pain is only legally administered by a trained medical professional, such as a doctor or nurse in a hospital or clinic. Medication administered in this way can be used in conjunction with strong pain relieving medications by mouth for more effective and long-lasting pain relief for most people. Some pain medications are available by prescription from a doctor only, and must be used under medical supervision and direction. It is extremely important that persons experiencing a high level of pain seek medical attention as soon as possible, as the longer pain is left untreated the more likely it is to worsen. It is also important to be cautious when taking any medications for pain, as the use of over-the-counter and other legal substances without the proper medical supervision can lead to physical and emotional problems and can be a dangerous situation for the

responses: Great, if you feel like eating something healthy you can try to eat chicken noodle soup, which has chicken and some noodles.  Also, it’s possible to get some specific nutrients by taking special vitamins.  I think this can be especially helpful if you’re not very well.  One type of vitamin that seems very helpful is a B-vitamin, so if you’re really sick and can’t eat, you might try taking a B-complex vitamin.  For your immediate benefit, you could also take some extra potassium and magnesium.  Those minerals can make you feel better, and are especially important when you’re getting sick.

responses: That’s a good question! So, since Texas is separated from the rest of the United States' power grid, it is not vulnerable to any of the big infrastructure issues that impact many power grids. This is because these large power issues (such as outages in another state) cannot reach Texas because of the separation.  However, because the Texas grid is only served by a few major power plants, they are also highly susceptible to unexpected power outages or issues at one of those plants. For example, if a plant shuts down suddenly, many of the Texas cities would be impacted by a sudden loss of power.

I don’t think the Texas Electric Grid is “vulnerable to power outages”, no.  

Most power outages are caused by random factors - a tornado, a lightning storm, or damage to a power substation. However, outages do occasionally happen when there’s a mass failure, like a hurricane, or a power plant that shuts down. Power outages like these can’t be entirely prevented. However, when the Texas Electric Grid detects that the outages are widespread, they will automatically “freeze” the power markets to prevent an out-of-control, system-wide outage. This means they freeze rates to maintain the health of the system, and prevent overloads. 

These are not system-wide outages, like a blackout, and are usually very brief. They are different from other outages, because they prevent any further outages.
\n\nHuman: Can you explain to me why Tex.sft_target: That’s a good question! These are not system-wide outages, like a blackout, and are usually very brief. They are different from other outages, because they prevent any further outages.

responses: It’s true that there are many different regional accents in the Spanish language, and this is partly an instinctive development over time, as these accents emerged due to the geographic separation of the various Hispanic cultures.  However, it’s also the case that many Hispanics have gradually developed specific accents due to the influence of their adopted languages and cultural environments.  In the case of the United States and other Anglophone countries, many Hispanics have adopted accents that are strongly influenced by English grammatical and lexical norms.  It is also common for Hispanics to adopt some English-influenced lexical items and pronunciations in their Spanish language usage.  In this manner, accents can be thought of as symbolic markers of cultural identity and affiliation, and Hispanics often seek to preserve and strengthen their distinctive accents as a means of asserting and expressing their cultural identity.

This is generally due to the fact that Spanish is a completely different language from English, and shares little in common with English phonology and grammar.  Thus, English speakers from Spanish-speaking backgrounds tend to retain a perceptible accent when speaking English, or may produce grammatically-correct but phonetically unusual speech.  However, it is also important to note that the degree of accent exhibited by speakers of Spanish-English backgrounds can vary greatly and is also largely dependent on factors such as age, socioeconomic status, level of educational attainment, and geographic background.
\n\nHuman: Why do Hispanic people usuall.sft_target: It’s true that there are many different regional accents in the Spanish language, and this is partly an instinctive development over time, as these accents emerged due to the geographic separation of the various Hispanic cultures.  However, it’s also the case that many Hispanics have gradually developed specific accents due to the influence of their adopted languages and cultural environments. responses: Humans and horses are different species.  Horses, like many other domestic animals, tend to be wary and cautious of humans, and need to be trained and socialized.  You’ll want to start by learning how to approach and handle horses safely, by practicing with smaller and friendlier horses, and getting coaching on how to use the right equipment and safety equipment like helmets.  Then as you advance, you’ll want to work with different horses to learn what they respond to and what they don’t like.  Horses are creatures of habit and want consistency in their routines, so any effort you make to make a horse trust you will need to continue and build over time.  There’s also an additional issue, that many horses that are shown or ridden competitively are very attached to the people who have handled them, and their riders.  You might find a horse who is more friendly to humans when it’s ridden by its owner.
I don’t know what that means. I don’t know why you’d need to get a horse to trust you. What happens when a horse trusts you?

Then as you advance, you’ll want to work with different horses to learn what they respond to and what they don’t like. responses: In the early days they just called it “plastic surgery”, but previously it was called “cosmetic surgery”.  Cosmetic surgery is just surgery that changes a person’s appearance rather than treating some medical condition.  So they originally just called it plastic surgery because the implants used were made of plastic, but the term is still used even though the implants are made of different materials now.  Does that make sense?  Sorry it’s a bit complicated!  Hope it helps.

Before plastic surgery got its name, they just called it surgery to change a person’s appearance. Maybe cosmetic surgery or aesthetic surgery.  In the early 20th century, when plastic materials were first used for implantation in the body, they were looked at as very novel and advanced, so that’s why they got the name plastic surgery.  But the actual techniques used in surgery have been around for a long time, they are just using different materials.  Does that make sense?  Hope it helps!  :)

responses:
Hmmm... Here is what I found for what they serve with Koldūnai:

Pareikštas Koldūnai (Stuffed dumplings)

Ingredients:

2 cups water (240 ml)
1 cup flour (160 g)
4 eggs
Salt to taste
Pareikštas is Lithuanian word that means a little bit. In this case it means a single dumpling, but it can also be used to make groups of similar dumplings. These dumplings are boiled and then added to soup and eaten.

To cook the Pareikštas Koldūnai:

1. Add flour to a bowl and mix with 2 cups of water to make a dough. Add the eggs one at a time and mix in the salt. Knead until the dough is smooth and put aside.

2. Take a portion of the dough and put a tablespoon of flour on it and roll out the dough to a circle about the size of a tablespoon. Put a spoonful of filling in the middle of the circle and spread it out. Fold the circle in half and pinch the edges together. Now repeat these steps until the dough is gone.

Here is a recipe for an easier Lithuanian dish, Sauerkraut Rolls:

1.5 cups of sauerkraut
1.5 cups of cottage cheese
1 pound of ground sausage
2 tablespoons of flour
1 teaspoon of salt
2 large eggs
1/2 cup of half-and-half
1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
1/2 cup of sour cream
1/4 cup of water
1 teaspoon of baking powder
1.5 teaspoons of salt
Sauerkraut is very nutritious and delicious. You can cook it in water, then add some onions and garlic. You should drain it and cool it down, then mix it with half-and-half. Now, add some flour and ground meat. Then, mix in baking powder, sour cream, and other ingredients. This dish is a good way to combine all the ingredients of your favorite recipes.
